Author: nreece
Content: That's what they said about the phone, until millions got one, and then gradually, voice support deteriorated. Imagine another few thousand people takling about the Comcast problem on Twitter. Will Comcast execs be able to follow Twitter to address individual problems as closely as they do now. I have my doubts.

Author: derefr
Content: But people would not accept a blog post made entirely of quotes, even ones that much deserve quotation. You have to say something, or you're just stealing someone else's act.

Author: aston
Content:
If you like that, you'll really like this: http://www.cs.princeton.edu/~rs/talks/LLRB/RedBlack.pdf

Sedgewick's left-leaving red-black trees. Easier code to understand, same performance bounds. Beware, though, some of the code in the preso doesn't really work as claimed.

Author: andreyf
Content:
They gave up on this one?

19. 'Tis known in refined company, that choosing K things out of N can be done in ways as many as choosing N minus K from N: I pick K, you the remaining. Find though a cooler bijection, where you show a knack uncanny, of making your choices contain all K of mine. Oh, for pedantry: let K be no more than half N.

Author: pierrefar
Content:
If you're a speed reader it doesn't mean you read everything quickly. It just means that if you choose to, you can.

A good novel is a terrible waste of time if read quickly. But a blog post announcing that company X has done something vaguely interesting shouldn't get too much time.

Author: pg
Content:
We'd be unlikely to own 6% of a co that got bought for $10m. We'd probably have been diluted down to 4% or so by later investors.

And there are actually a fair number of schleps. As work goes, the effort is somewhere between a regular job and running a startup.
